intro: Veronica kosteleckii, commonly known as the Sierra veronica, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Veronica kosteleckii is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
